benchmark_details.name: CANDY
benchmark_details.overview: CANDY is a benchmark designed to systematically evaluate the capabilities and limitations of large language models in fact-checking Chinese misinformation, including a curated dataset of approximately 20,000 instances.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation and in-depth analysis of large language modelsâ€™ ability to fact-check Chinese misinformation.

data.source: Collected from authoritative Chinese fact-checking platforms such as the China Internet United Rumor Refutation Platform.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by a team of annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using micro-averaging methods.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better fact-checking performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline models include sixteen large language models and three large reasoning models.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures involved inter-rater reliability checks using Fleiss' Kappa.
